pageContext.claim: “I was never involved with the security. I know that he -- you know, just from reading -- I know that there was issues back and forth about security for numerous people, actually. But I don't want to get involved in that stuff.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump denied he played any role in the security clearance granted to his son-in-law, Jared Kushner. But the New York Times reported on Feb. 28 that he personally directed White House chief of staff John Kelly to give Kushner the security clearance despite concerns flagged by intelligence officials and the White House’s top lawyer.
